page.title: 17Social Concerns in Rogate
page.content: Much interest is maintained in the village by amateur historians or the environment by the Red House a field study centre for King's College, London. But several residents were concerned about the lack of interest for young people who were being attracted to activities outside the village. A much more pressing concern however was the exploration and drilling for oil. Athough this is actually outside the surveyed area, villagers were concerned with the immediate problems of heavy traffic and the possible complete change finding a commercially viable amount, would bring. A reduction in the staff at the school was until recently another concern when the number of children dropped, but with closure of Elsted School this has been abated.
